availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Preston B. Morrow (Woodford County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, police judge, and politician)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, police judge, and politician. Kentucky native. Filed a marriage bond to Elizabeth S. Hall Morrow in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 13, 1836. Father of Joseph C. Morrow, Samuel Morrow, and Belle Morrow Harding. Licensed to marry Rebecca A. Davis Morrow in Woodford County on August 19, 1848. Married to Emily V. Whittaker in Woodford County on September 26, 1850. Merchant in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Police court judge in Versailles in 1861. Delegate from Woodford County to the Union Democratic State Convention in Louisville in 1864.
